moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4: Nimzo-Indian. highly popular in the last decade.
moves.4. e3: more popular are Qc2, g3, Nf3.
moves.4... Bxc3+: I don't know if it is theory or not but I wouldn't exchange the bishop for the Knight just yet. I think I would play in this situation c5 or d5 to keep the tension in the center.
moves.5. bxc3 d5 6. Nf3: white can take once on d5 and then play c4 again...
moves.9... Nb6 10. Be2 Na5: there is no realy attack on c4. Rc1 would solve all of white problems.
moves.12. O-O Nc6 13. Rab1 Rb8: black cant castle on the king side and now he cant casyle on the queen side. the black king stays in the center, which means trouble.
moves.14. Bd3 Ne7 15. Ne5: white has a lot of space to manouver his pieces. it seems that white has a great chance by attacking.
moves.17. Rxb6:
!
two pieces for the rook. a good deal!
moves.20. Nxc6 bxc6 21. Qxc6: white has taken over the board!
moves.21... a6 22. Bd6 Rdc8: ? the next move shows the reason.
